itemLabel: The Wall of Philip II Augustus

A medieval house adorned with enigmatic carvings, including one of a man displaying his masculine attributes.

itemLabel: Pyramid Mausoleum at Abandoned La Boulaye Cemetery

Balconies that have a most unusual accent.

itemLabel: Les Étagères de la Nuit (Shelves of the Night)

itemLabel: Napoleon's Camel at the Musée africain de l'île d'Aix

itemLabel: Temple des Mille Bouddhas (Temple of One Thousand Buddhas)

itemLabel: The Death Mask of Gabrielle Danton

A gruesome combat between a hunter and a furious momma bear.

itemLabel: The French Resistance Memorials of Cadenet

itemLabel: Le Petit Train de La Mure

itemLabel: Escalier du roi d'Aragon (King of Aragon’s Stairs)

A miniature diorama that recounts the brilliant stories of author and filmmaker Marcel Pagnol.
This giant metal cross perched atop a mountain can only be reached by foot.

itemLabel: Musee de l'insolite (Museum of the Unusual)

A bizarre sculpture garden in the south of France.

These red marks, seemingly placed at random, are in fact not.

itemLabel: Musée de l'Histoire de la Médecine (Museum of the History of Medicine)
ao_description: A journey through the history of medicine throughout the centuries.

itemLabel: La Maison du Brie de Meaux

A public center dedicated to showcasing and conserving the enormous shaggy Poitou donkey.
View one man's eccentric collection of nearly 5,000 corkscrews, then sip some Chablis.

This tower is one of the best-preserved (and least-visited) remnants of medieval Paris.
From Carthage's Hannibal to riders of the Tour de France, many have crossed this scenic route through the Alps.

itemLabel: Musée d'Art et d'Industrie Paul Charnoz

itemLabel: Lieu de Rencontre (Field of the Encounter)

Designed to mark the geographical center of France.
This saucy statue once caused outrage among locals.

itemLabel: Musée de la Coutellerie (Thiers Cutlery Museum)
ao_description: The history of knife-making in this French city is explored through this museum.

A 15th-century Corsican chapel that possesses a rare Catholic monument: a "Scala Santa," or "Holy Stairs."

Reminiscent of a termite mound, this imposing structure is likely an ancient funerary monument.

The home and studio of one of the most celebrated female artists of the 19th century.

A very uncommon water tank standing in the middle of the grapevines in Bordeaux nearly a century after its construction.

itemLabel: Site of La Morgue de Paris

A memorial to honor those who were killed in a Bastille Day terror attack in Nice.

A suburban housing complex with astonishing architectural features, locally nicknamed "the Camemberts."
This unassuming sculpture depicts grandfather of science fiction Jules Verne and his brother as children.
The macabre collection of Jacques Sirgent, an expert scholar on the undead and all of their trappings.

The celebrated eyesore created by starry-eyed sweethearts.
Skeletons, medical artifacts, and other obscure and precious treasures all displayed in a wooden pharmacist's cabinet.
One of the last umbrella repair shops in Paris upholds the nostalgic art of umbrella making.
Inside a former cabaret, seven floors of erotic art.
The largest medical and anatomical collection in France lies hidden from the public.

An antique curios dealer and hybrid taxidermist.
An all-American grocery store in Paris sells U.S. "cuisine" like Pop-Tarts and Heinz ketchup to homesick ex-pats.

This is what trains will look like after the zombie apocalypse.
This demon atop the Notre-Dame de Paris looks utterly bored.
Dolls of all shapes and sizes display the eras of femininity in this spooky and beautiful collection.

itemLabel: François Richard's Scientific Devices and Odd Machinery

Got apples?
A font of vintage porn on the silver screen.
A Belle Epoque bordello turned into a themed love hotel.

A curious collection of locks and keys.
15,000 year old bison sculptures.

From the dishes to the art, this Michelin-starred restaurant orbits around one beloved French melon.
Sleep in the hay, spin the wheel and eat grain pellets to your heart's delight.

itemLabel: Canard Digérateur de Vaucanson (Vaucanson's Digesting Duck)
